info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Nueces, northwestern San Patricio, northeastern Jim Wells, southwestern Refugio, southeastern Live Oak and south central Bee Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 514 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Papalote, or near Skidmore, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sinton, Mathis, Skidmore, Orange Grove, St. Paul, Lake City, San Patricio, Lagarto, Edroy, Tynan, Sandia, West Sinton, Argenta, Papalote, Mount Lucas, Dinero, Lakeside, Lake Corpus Christi and Pernitas Point. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 23 and 47. US Highway 181 between mile markers 604 and 620. US Highway 77 between mile markers 638 and 646. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If on or near Lake Corpus Christi, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
